messages.message: It seems like the Docsbot link from the AI Hub home page navigates to an old version of the bot. So here, in the Featured Apps section. The correct URL is https://aihub.instabase.com/hub/apps/shared/Instabase/Explore%20AIHub%20Docs. This card goes to the 24.18 docsbot instead.
cc @Kerry, who found this issue. Is this where you were coming from, or was the bad link elsewhere too?
There were some changes to chatbot handling, iirc, and I imagine this one just wasn’t updated.

So there are two docs bot it appears, in my AI Hub home screen
One is called `Explore AI Hub Docs`, the other is called `Explore AIHub Docs` . The AIHub Docs one is up to date, and the AI Hub Docs one is out of date (last updated in May). @jean, can you figure this out with @avi @Balaram? Apparently one was used at one point and the other is used after May. We just need to unpublish one.
@avi, I can’t find this old AI Hub docsbot in any of my spaces---when I look for AI Hub docsbot, I get these two results:

I deleted the old one, as we discussed way back then, but it doesn’t look like it really went away. We’ll also need to make sure the correct docsbot is listed under the featured apps section, I imagine.

@Kerry In the featured app section, with the site_admin profile I am seeing the older chatbot. We will debug further here.

In the database, "Explore AI Hub docs" is in Inactive state.
@Aayush Can you check and let us know what API is used to populate the featured section in the Home page?

It's taking the featured app list from a constant (`webserver/shared/src/js/webpacked/apps/src/aihub/pages/Landing/HomePageRefreshLanding/constants.ts`) and rendering them after getting the app deatils of each of these. This also includes `Explore AI Hub Docs` which is outdated now.
We should replace `Explore AI Hub Docs` with `Explore AIHub Docs` and that should fix this. This doesn't appear for non admins because the app details endpoint doesn't return the details
